deadline.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of Deadline Hollywood, a breaking news source for the movie, television, and entertainment industry. Deadline was founded by journalist Nikki Finke.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Deadline is owned by Penske Media Corporation (PMC), a private digital media company that owns numerous media brands, including WWD, Rolling Stone, Robb Report, and Variety. PMC, based in Los Angeles, acquired Deadline Hollywood in 2009. The site runs advertisements.

Content

The site primarily produces original content about the business of the entertainment industry. Stories range from box office performances of recent movies to TV show cancellations (“‘Colony’ Canceled By USA Network After 3 Seasons”), from actors under consideration for various roles to others leaving shows (“‘Riverdale’: Penelope Ann Miller Joins Season 3 Cast Of CW Series”). The site also publishes hard news from third-party outlets on other topics, including the Trump administration. It features original interviews with actors and directors, as well as film and TV reviews.

Credibility

Deadline features original reporting by experienced entertainment journalists, links to credible sources and uses headlines that accurately reflect the content. Stories frequently rely on anonymous sources, a common practice in the entertainment and gossip media industry. The site does not provide a corrections policy, and does not appear to publish corrections. Deadline did not respond to two NewsGuard emails asking about its corrections policy. 

Transparency

The site’s “About Us” page lists biographical and contact information for Deadline’s editorial staff and general manager. Articles generally provide the writer’s name and email address. The site makes clear its affiliation to PMC, detailing the history of Deadline, its owner, and its founder. The “Got a Tip?” page provides a general web form, email address, and Santa Monica street address. Advertisements are clearly labeled.

History

Deadline Hollywood began as a weekly print column written by Nikki Finke for the newspaper LA Weekly. The online blog was launched in 2006 and was bought by PMC (then known as Mail.com Media Corp) in 2009. Finke remained editor after the sale, but left in 2013.
